message: I particularly like how much more character-driven it seems to be.

A slew of new, detailed previews just hit the interwebz, and the game sounds like it's shaping up to be something amazing.

Eurogamer: http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-05-23-bioshock-infinite-preview

Joystiq: http://www.joystiq.com/2011/05/23/bioshock-infinite-preview-tears-in-the-sky-line/

Ars Technica: http://arstechnica.com/gaming/news/2011/05/bioshock-infinite-writeup-embargoed-to-death-and-back.ars

This is starting to sound good.  The "gameplay" video released a while back failed to convince me, though I was willing to give the game a break on account of the original setting alone…

I really do like the fact that NPCs no longer attack you on sight.  That was always one thing that totally spoiled the illusion of Rapture as a living city.

New video, with a feature I hadn't heard of:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JTuGUqfuTGs

If you do anything, watch the last twenty seconds, because it's one of the most phenomenal things I've ever seen.
I'm trying to avoid as much as possible of this game. I know I'll get it at launch, and I don't want to spoil that experience too much.

The entire E3 demo will be showcased next week, but here's the first two minutes:

http://www.gametrailers.com/video/e3-2011-bioshock-infinite/716994
